steps.title: Be sure you've washed your hands with antibacterial soap before touching the jewelry or the fistula (piercing hole)[1] X Research source
steps.content: Be sure you've washed your hands with antibacterial soap before touching the jewelry or the fistula (piercing hole) [1] X Research source

steps.title: Stretch one size at a time.
steps.content: Stretch one size at a time. Sizes go down in number, by two's (for example, 12g to 10g, etc). You will regret it if you do not as you will cause scar tissue and a blowout.

steps.title: Use a water based lubricant or a specialized stretching oil.
steps.content: Use a water based lubricant or a specialized stretching oil. Do not use petroleum jelly or anything else that will clog up the piercing and trap bacteria.(Do NOT use Neosporin!) [2] X Research source

steps.title: Never use acrylic/silicone/kaos/collapsible plugs or tunnels to stretch, they will irritate your piercing and more often than not tear your ear.
steps.content: Never use acrylic/silicone/kaos/collapsible plugs or tunnels to stretch, they will irritate your piercing and more often than not tear your ear. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Use a taper to stretch the piercing.
steps.content: Use a taper to stretch the piercing.

steps.title: Soak the area with sea salt to draw out any possible infections.
steps.content: Soak the area with sea salt to draw out any possible infections.
